title-group.article-title: Application of Engine Load Estimation Method Using Crank Angular Velocity Variation to Spark Advance Control

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright © 2014 SAE International and Copyright © 2014 SAE Japan

abstract.label: ABSTRACT
abstract.p: The technology to estimate engine load using the amplitude of crankshaft angular velocity variation during a cycle, which is referred to as “Δω(delta omega)”, in a four-stroke single-cylinder gasoline engine has been established in our former studies. This study was aimed to apply this technology to the spark advance control system for small motorcycles. The cyclic variation of theΔωsignal, which affects engine load detection accuracy, was a crucial issue when developing the system. To solve this issue, filtering functions that can cope with various running conditions were incorporated into the computation process that estimates engine loads fromΔωsignals. In addition, the system made it possible to classify engine load into two levels without a throttle sensor currently used. We have thus successfully developed the new spark advance system that is controlled in accordance with the engine speed and load.
